annotation.spannedText: People at increased risk of contracting hepatitis B should be immunised

classMention.mentionClass: People at increased risk of contracting hepatitis B should be immunised

annotation.spannedText: See your practice nurse if you think you need this vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: See your practice nurse if you think you need this vaccine

annotation.spannedText: Anyone who is at increased risk of being infected with the hepatitis B virus should consider being immunised

classMention.mentionClass: Anyone who is at increased risk of being infected with the hepatitis B virus should consider being immunised

annotation.spannedText: Seek medical attention as soon as possible if you have been at risk from a possible source of infection and you are not immunised

classMention.mentionClass: Seek medical attention as soon as possible if you have been at risk from a possible source of infection and you are not immunised

annotation.spannedText: You should have an injection of immunoglobulin as soon as possible

classMention.mentionClass: You should have an injection of immunoglobulin as soon as possible

annotation.spannedText: You should also start a course of immunisation

classMention.mentionClass: You should also start a course of immunisation

annotation.spannedText: Even if you have had the hepatitis B vaccine and are at risk of infection (for example, by having unprotected sex or sharing contaminated needles), you should ask your doctor for advice

classMention.mentionClass: Even if you have had the hepatitis B vaccine and are at risk of infection (for example, by having unprotected sex or sharing contaminated needles), you should ask your doctor for advice

annotation.spannedText: Babies who are born to infected mothers should have an injection of immunoglobulin as soon as possible after they are born

classMention.mentionClass: Babies who are born to infected mothers should have an injection of immunoglobulin as soon as possible after they are born

annotation.spannedText: If you have an illness causing a high temperature, it is best to postpone immunisation until after the illness

classMention.mentionClass: If you have an illness causing a high temperature, it is best to postpone immunisation until after the illness

annotation.spannedText: You should not have a booster if you have had a severe reaction to this vaccine in the past

classMention.mentionClass: You should not have a booster if you have had a severe reaction to this vaccine in the past
